application.doc: Retrieving security action events for a Reverse Proxy instance

param.name: date
param.doc: The starting time, represented as a UNIX time stamp.

param.name: duration
param.doc: The duration of records from the starting time to retrieve, in seconds. (For example, 86400 for one day)

param.name: instance
param.doc: The name of the Reverse Proxy instance to retrieve records for.

param.name: type
param.doc: The type of actions to return. This is a sum of any of the type+x values listed in this table. For example, type=1 for dropped requests, type=3 for dropped requests and blocked clients, type=4 for ignored events, type=15 for all events. type+1 : Events that resulted in requests being dropped. type+2 : Events that resulted in clients being blocked. type+4 : Events that were ignored. type+8 : Events that were audited.

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieving security action events for a Reverse Proxy instance
method.doc: To retrieve security action event records for a Reverse Proxy instance using the web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the resource URI.

request.doc:
Example 1: Retrieving security action events on the default2 instance that dropped requests or blocked clients. (type = 1 + 2 = 3) GET https://{appliance_hostname}/analysis/reverse_proxy_traffic/pam_events?duration=86400&date=1390323600&instance=default2&type=3
Example 2: Retrieving all security action events on the default instance. (type = 1 + 2 + 4 + 8 = 15) GET https://{appliance_hostname}/analysis/reverse_proxy_traffic/pam_events?duration=86400&date=1390323600&instance=default&type=15
Example 3: Retrieving just the security action events that dropped requests on the default instance. (type = 1) GET https://{appliance_hostname}/analysis/reverse_proxy_traffic/pam_events?duration=86400&date=1390323600&instance=default&type=1

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: bucket_size
param.doc: The interval of the records, in seconds. (For example, 600 for ten minutes, 86400 for 24 hours)

param.name: instance
param.doc: The name of the Reverse Proxy instance records were returned for.

param.name: start_time
param.doc: The time of the first record returned in this set.

param.name: t
param.doc: The starting time of this interval.

param.name: e
param.doc: The total number of recorded actions during this interval.
